sn35.186:0.3: 186. The Interior Was Impermanent in the Past
sn35.186:1.1: “Mendicants, in the past the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind were impermanent.
sn35.186:1.2: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn35.186:1.3: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
sn35.186:1.4: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
